title: Watchmen episode 1 hailed 'best pilot ever' as Regina King makes debut
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

**Warning, minor spoilers for Watchmen ahead**

The first episode of the hotly-anticipated series Watchmen premiered on HBO last night and fans are already obsessed.

The superhero show based on Alan Moore’s classic graphic novel of the same name sees Regina King at the helm as Detective Angela Abar, whose alter-ego is Sister Night, with Don Johnson and Tim Blake Nelson by her side.

‘Watchmen takes place in an alternative, contemporary reality in the United States, in which masked vigilantes became outlawed due to their violent methods,’ reads the official synopsis.

Advertisement

‘Despite this, some gather around in order to start a revolution while others are out to stop it before it is too late, as a greater question rises above them all; who watches the Watchmen?’

The pilot episode, titled It’s Summer And We’re Running Out Of Ice, began with the Black Wall Street massacre at Tulsa in 1921, with a black couple giving their son to a family who take him to safety.

Watchmen has landed! (Picture: HBO)

Moments later the boy’s parents and new family get killed, leaving just him and a baby alive and they leave Tulsa together.

There’s then a flashforward to an alternate 2019 where police officers conceal their identities by wearing masks.

After one cop gets shot by a member of the white supremacy group Seventh Calvary and hospitalised, Chief Judd Crawford (Don Johnson ) calls for an investigation to hunt down the attacker.

Regina’s character Angela soon gets information on the shooter and along with Crawford goes to hunt down the members, resulting in a bloody shootout.

Sometime later though, Crawford faces road turblence and Angela gets a creepy phone call from someone who tells her to find something near a tree. When she arrives at the destination, she finds an old black man in a wheelchair near Crawford’s lynched body.

Regina King is a boss (Picture: HBO)

Unsurprisingly, viewers are totally obsessed with the series so far.

Many have called the episode ‘the best pilot’ they’ve seen, while others have praised Regina’s performance.

Fans are obsessed (Picture: Twitter)

‘Wow @watchmen was crazy! I want more! Any doubt that @ReginaKing is one of the best actresses of this generation?’ wrote one, as another added: ‘OK, Watchmen is friggin’ brilliant. Like, out of this world, one of the best pilots I’ve ever seen. Holy crap. What an entrance.’

Echoing a similar sentiment, another posted: ‘Granted it’s just one episode, but Watchmen is everything I want from a TV show. From the score to the political themes, this show is off the charts!’

Yep, Watchmen will be your next obsession whether you like it or not.

We’ve created a list of shows for you to sink your teeth into while you patiently wait for the next episode to land.

Watchmen is available to stream on HBO in the US and Sky Atlantic and NOW TV in the UK.
